availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Stephen B. Mankins (Tennessee resident, soldier in 3rd Ky Mtd Inf (csa))

body.p: Rutherford County, Tennessee, resident and Kentucky soldier. Tennessee native. Son of Stephen B. Mankins and Sarah Mankins. Resident of Middleton, Tennessee, in 1850. Resident of Bedford County, Tennessee, in 1860. Served in the 3rd Kentucky Mounted Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) as private from July 10, 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Rutherford County, Middleton, p. 233A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Bedford County, Western Division District 10, p. 227.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky: Confederate Kentucky Volunteers War 1861-65, vol. 1 (Frankfort: Legislature of Kentucky, 1915), 100.
"Stephen B. Mankin (1835-1862)," Find A Grave, Memorial #55460206, accessed January 28, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/55460206.
